note: Subject/Participant Identifier (primary key)

Information field about cohort. Suggested use case is for the identification of a set of subjects from a specific data provider in order to identify this subset within searches (and for manuscript referencing)
GREGoR Center to which the participant is originally associated
Consent group pertaining to this participant's data
Is the originating GREGoR Center likely able to recontact this participant
Text description of any genetic testing for individual conducted prior to enrollment
Case specific PubMed ID if applicable
Identifier for family
subject_id for father; 0 if not available
subject_id for mother; 0 if not available
subject_id for twins, triplets, etc; 0 if not available
Text description of individual relationship to proband in family, especially useful to capture relationships when connecting distant relatives and connecting relatives not studied
Other proband relationship not captured in enumeration above
Biological sex assigned at birth (aligned with All of Us). If individual has a known DSD / not expected sex chromosome karyotype, this can be noted in the phenotype information section.
Optional free-text field to describe known discrepancies between 'sex' value (female=>XX, male=>XY) and actual sex chromosome karyotype
Self/submitter-reported race (OMB categories)
Self/submitter-reported ethnicity (OMB categories)
Additional specific ancestry description free text beyond what is captured by OMB race/ethnicity categories

Age at last observation, aka age in years at the last time the center can vouch for the accuracy phenotype data. For conditions with later age of onset, this field lets users know if individuals marked as unaffected were younger or older than the age when the phenotype is expected to appear.
Indicate affected status of individual (overall with respect to primary phenotype in the family)
human-readable ""Phenotypic one-line summary"" for why this individual is of interest. Could be the same as the term_details value in the Phenotype table. Strongly encourage/required for proband.
age in years at which consent was originally obtained
Identifier for family (primary key)
Indicate if consanguinity is present or suspected within a family
Free text description of any additional consanguinity details
name of file (renamed from pedigree_image because it can contain a PED file or image)
Free text description of other family structure/pedigree file caption or legend.
Details about family history that do not fit into structured fields. Family relationship terms should be relative to the proband.
